alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 9:55AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF BEDFORD...SOMERSET...BLAIR... AND CAMBRIA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 955 AM EDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Ebensburg to 15 miles southeast of Uniontown and moving east at 35 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Patton, Carrolltown and Loretto around 1000 AM EDT. Prince Gallitzin State Park and Gallitzin around 1005 AM EDT. Horseshoe Curve and Blandburg around 1015 AM EDT. Altoona and Mount Davis around 1020 AM EDT. Bellwood around 1025 AM EDT. Meyersdale around 1030 AM EDT. * This includes The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 101 to 132. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
